climbs.name: Tippy Toes
climbs.fa: Paul Humphrey, Dave Manheimer and Eric Chemello 1997

content.description: Tippy Toes is a thin edge climb to the right of Pelican's BVD's. It is the left of 3 quality slab route that end at the same anchor.

climbs.name: Tap Dance
climbs.fa: Paul Humphrey, Dave Manheimer and Eric Chemello 1997

content.description: Another thin edge climb on the North Face. This one is just right of Tippy Toes and is slightly easier. Fun!
Pelican's BVD's is the first route you will encounter on the left edge of the North Face. The climb starts on a delicate slab and finishes  on an ever steepening overhang.
content.location: Left most route on the North Face.

content.description:
Fun wide crack or undercling layback. Both options go at the same grade: 5.8 for the majority of the climb, then a short section of 5.9 near the top. Leading it as a layback would be X rated as it would be impossible to get any gear on the whole route. One of very few wide crack options on the North Coast, and a very good one at that. Great place to practice wide crack technique, especially with the top rope access.

To top rope, hike up and left around the backside and climb up a short 5.2 chimney ramp.
content.protection:
2-3" and 8-12"

Long chordalette to extend anchor over the lip (bolts 4.5' back).

content.description: This is the farthest right route on the North Face slab. Stay to the bolt line to avoid loose rock to the right. This is a good warm up to get ready for Tippy Toes and Tap Dance.
